t: It*pn shall come to pass in the latter days that*ld the mountain of the house of the Lord*s shall*ln be established as the highest of the mountains, and*ld it shall be lifted up above the hills; and*ln peoples shall flow to it,

and*ld many nations shall come, and say: “Come,*ln let us go up to the mountain of the Lord,*s to*ld the house of the God of Jacob, that*ln he may teach us his ways and*ld that we may walk in his paths.” For*ln out of Zion shall go forth the law, and*ld the word of the Lord*s from Jerusalem.

He*ln shall judge between many peoples, and*ld shall decide disputes for strong nations far away; and*ln they shall beat their swords into plowshares, and*ld their spears into pruning hooks; nation*ln shall not lift up sword against nation, neither*ld shall they learn war anymore;
but*ln they shall sit every man under his vine and under his fig tree, and*ld no one shall make them afraid, for*ld the mouth of the Lord*s of hosts has spoken.
For*ln all the peoples walk each*ld in the name of its god, but*ln we will walk in the name of the Lord*s our God forever*ld and ever.
In*pn that day, declares the Lord,*s I*ld will assemble the lame and*ln gather those who have been driven away and*ld those whom I have afflicted;
and*ln the lame I will make the remnant, and*ld those who were cast off, a strong nation; and*ln the Lord*s will reign over them in Mount Zion from*ld this time forth and forevermore.
And*pn you, O tower of the flock, hill*ld of the daughter of Zion, to*ln you shall it come, the*ld former dominion shall come, kingship*ld for the daughter of Jerusalem.
Now*pn why do you cry aloud? Is*ld there no king in you? Has*ln your counselor perished, that*ld pain seized you like a woman in labor?

Writhe*ln and groan, O daughter of Zion, like*ld a woman in labor, for*ln now you shall go out from the city and*ld dwell in the open country; you*ld shall go to Babylon. There*ln you shall be rescued; there*ld the Lord*s will redeem you from*ld the hand of your enemies.
Now*pn many nations are*ld assembled against you, saying,*ln “Let her be defiled, and*ld let our eyes gaze upon Zion.”
But*ln they do not know the*ld thoughts of the Lord;*s they*ln do not understand his plan, that*ld he has gathered them as sheaves to the threshing floor.

Arise*ln and thresh, O*ld daughter of Zion, for*ln I will make your horn iron, and*ld I will make your hoofs bronze; you*ln shall beat in pieces many peoples; and*ld shall devote their gain to the Lord,*s their*ld wealth to the Lord of the whole earth.
